title: Projectile motion - graphs of vertical components

content.description: A projectile is launched with initial speed <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math> at an angle <math alttext="theta sub 0" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <msub> <mi>θ</mi> <mn>0</mn> </msub> </mstyle> </math> above the horizontal. The projectile follows the trajectory shown in the figure.
content.question: Which of the following pairs of graphs best represents the vertical components of the velocity and acceleration <math alttext="v sub y" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <msub> <mi>v</mi> <mi>y</mi> </msub> </mstyle> </math> and <math alttext="a sub y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>y</mi></msub></mstyle></math>, respectively, of the projectile as functions of time?

choices.label: Two figures are shown. Each figure shows the graph of a line in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. In the first graph the horizontal axis is labeled “t” and the vertical axis is labeled “v sub y.” The line begins near the top of the vertical axis, slants downward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis halfway along it, and continues downward and to the right to end below the horizontal axis and near the bottom of the vertical axis. In the second graph the horizontal axis is labeled “t” and the vertical axis is labeled “a sub y.” The line begins near the top of the vertical axis, slants downward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis halfway along it, and continues downward and to the right to end below the horizontal axis and near the bottom of the vertical axis.

Two figures are shown. Each figure shows the graph of a line in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. In the first graph the horizontal axis is labeled “t” and the vertical axis is labeled “v sub y.” The line begins near the top of the vertical axis, slants downward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis halfway along it, and continues downward and to the right to end below the horizontal axis and near the bottom of the vertical axis. In the second graph the horizontal axis is labeled “t” and the vertical axis is labeled “a sub y.” The line begins near the bottom of the vertical axis, and moves horizontally to the right to end at the end of the horizontal axis.

Two figures are shown. Each figure shows the graph of a line in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. In the first graph the horizontal axis is labeled “t” and the vertical axis is labeled “v sub y.” The line begins near the top of the vertical axis, slants downward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis halfway along it, and continues downward and to the right to end below the horizontal axis and near the bottom of the vertical axis. In the second graph the horizontal axis is labeled “t” and the vertical axis is labeled “a sub y.” The line begins halfway between the origin and the top of the vertical axis, and moves horizontally to the right to end at the end of the horizontal axis.

Two figures are shown. Each figure shows the graph of a line in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. In the first graph the horizontal axis is labeled “t” and the vertical axis is labeled “v. sub y” The line begins near the bottom of the vertical axis, slants upward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis halfway along it, and continues upward and to the right to end above the horizontal axis and near the top of the vertical axis. In the second graph the horizontal axis is labeled “t” and the vertical axis is labeled “a sub y.” The line begins at the origin, and moves horizontally to the right to end at the end of the horizontal axis.

content.answer: Two figures are shown. Each figure shows the graph of a line in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. In the first graph the horizontal axis is labeled “t” and the vertical axis is labeled “v sub y.” The line begins near the top of the vertical axis, slants downward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis halfway along it, and continues downward and to the right to end below the horizontal axis and near the bottom of the vertical axis. In the second graph the horizontal axis is labeled “t” and the vertical axis is labeled “a sub y.” The line begins near the bottom of the vertical axis, and moves horizontally to the right to end at the end of the horizontal axis.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
